content.body:
> <@nicolo-ribaudo:matrix.org> Also, I don't understand yet how that ECMA-262 hook works, but I'm surprised/disappointed that non-browsers are forbidden from behaving like browsers.

This is bringing back an old conversation, but: Yeah, I disagree with how we've been prohibiting that as well. I don't know the exact history of it, but I think Jordan likes this property (partly with the understanding that environments which are emulating a browser "are" a browser and can use that clause)
